newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian stocks open lower, News Corp dips.
newsitem.headline: Australian stocks open lower, News Corp dips.

text.p: Australian shares opened just lower on Tuesday in a mixed showing with few definitive signals from overseas markets.
Shares in media giant News Corp followed its ADRs down after a reported downgrade by a U.S. stockbroker and weighed on the industrials sector and overall market.
At 10.25 a.m. (0025 GMT), the All Ordinaries index was two points lower at 2,361.2.
The December share price index futures contract was one point lower at 2377, a 15.8-point premium to the underlying index.
"It doesn't know what it's doing and is stuck in a tight range. BHP is up and that is keeping it close to square," said dealer Brett O'Donovan of brokerage Lance Jones.
O'Donovan said he expected only light activity during the day with little guidance from foreign markets and with third-quarter inflation figures due on Wednesday.
"There is no real lead from overseas and it has been very quiet so far. I'm expecting a flat day as people await the results tomorrow," he said.
Rises outnumbered falls by a ratio of about 11 to 10, while about 41 percent of stocks traded remained steady.
